cape_names.note: Called this by Tattletale as she hasn't yet thought of a cape name
Was named this by Gallant after the bank robbery
Was named this by Gallant after the bank robbery and it caught on via Lung after his escape; she doesn't love it but can cope with it

based_in.value: A house on the outskirts of the Docks with Danny Hebert

notes.value: PoV character
Was hospitalised in the psychiatric ward after one grotesque bullying incident
About fifteen years old at the start of the story
Finds acting as a supervillain to be an escape
Is freaked out by drugs

parahuman_type.note: In her own head, and as presented to Armsmaster
To the rest of the world

appearance.value: Dark curly hair; thin-lipped, wide, expressive mouth; large eyes; gawky figure
Generally wears modest, dull clothes
Wears glasses
Attractiveness somewhere between nerd and plain
Her silhouette is hard to make out through her cloud of bugs

cape_costumes.brief_desc: Black and gray black widow bodysuit and mask

notes.value: Made of black widow spider silk
Main costume dirty yellow-gray; armoured sections dark mottled brown-gray
Armoured sections of finely arranged, layered shells and exoskeletons, reinforced with dragline silk
Armour covers face, chest, spine, stomach, major joints; with jaw armour imitating a bug's mandibles
Mask with dull yellow lenses, does not cover hair/back of the head
Dyed and painted black and gray
Soft-soled feet
Pouch in the spine containing EpiPens, pen and notepad, pepper spray, chalk dust

Pouch in the spine containing EpiPens, pen and notepad, pepper spray, chalk dust, combat knife (blade over 6" long, textured handle with three symmetrical indents on each side for grip, strong enough to be used as a crowbar), 21" telescoping combat baton

Pouch in the spine containing EpiPens, pen and notepad, pepper spray, combat knife (blade over 6" long, textured handle with three symmetrical indents on each side for grip, strong enough to be used as a crowbar), 21" telescoping combat baton, a change-purse with spare change and a twenty, an unused burner phone
Most of the armour panels are separate pieces held in place by straps running into slits in the fabric
Some armour part of the bodysuit itself; narrow rigid sections along centre of chest, back, shins, wrists, hips, tops of shoulders, which interlocks with grooves on the panels
Black tank top and black biking shorts worn underneath for extra warmth
Pouch also contains combat knife, blade over 6" long, textured handle with three symmetrical indents on each side for grip, strong enough to be used as a crowbar; 21" telescoping combat baton
Pouch also contains smelling salts
Granularity ranges from individual bug antennae to moving whole swarms or arbitrary sub-groups in formation
Can detect the species of a given bug
Range ~2 blocks
Can sense the location of each bug in the swarm (can be tuned out)
Can sense through the senses of the bugs (can be tuned out)
Range ~2 blocks or ⅒  mile

As bugs can sense at a much greater speed, signals from bugs are translated to a way human brains can understand, and are thus muted; visual info is ink blot patches of light and dark; sound painful to focus on and very distorted
Sense of location translates well, can easily tell where a bug is in relation to her, and know acutely if they are still, moving on their own, or being moved
Works on crabs and earthworms; thinks it will work on anything with a simple enough brain
Can sense air currents via bugs with hairs on their bodies, and can smell through bugs
Bugs continue to obey her last command even when she's unconscious
In one instance, could recognise music through the bugs though was confused about the genre
After meeting with school when she still had concussion, found her range was extended from 2 blocks to 3½
Bugs can be set to do fairly complex tasks (eg stealing money from a safe, collecting it into bags, and moving it some distance away) with very little conscious effort on her part
Bullying had been ongoing for over 1½ years before trigger event
Bullying had tailed off between November and the winter break
Immediately before the winter break the bullies had filled Taylor's locker almost completely with used tampons and pads
Taylor opened her locker after Christmas, threw up in the hall, before being grabbed by the hair (likely by Sophia) and shoved into the locker
Locker was locked, Taylor was trapped with the rancid smell and her own puke, and nobody was calling the janitor or a teacher to let her out

During the trigger event, Taylor was overwhelmed with the information her new power was giving her on the bugs; it felt like thousands of twitchy, alien, distorted things shoving every tiny detail about their bodies and biology into her head
Every sound was bounced back at a hundred times the volume, distorted to make it unpleasant and painful to listen to; and thousands of eyes like looking into a dingy grimy kaleidoscope
When she was finally let out she came out fighting and screaming incoherently; paramedics eventually arrived
Teacher who tries to be the 'cool' teacher
Notices Taylor's being bullied but is completely ineffectual to stop it
Popular kid

appearance.value: 'Adorable'; petite; shoulder length brown hair; cutesy attitude; late bloomer

notes.value: Runner on the school track team
Was likely directly involved in the locker incident

appearance.value: 'Prom queen' image; dark skinned; slender, athletic build
Black hair normally long enough to reach the small of her back

notes.value: Leader of Taylor-bullying group
Has a sister (unnamed)

appearance.value: 'Prom queen' image; red-headed; all the curves the guys want; looks good enough to be a local model

notes.value: Strong accent
Employs an estimated 40–50 thugs
Previously made it his mission to consolidate all the Asians into one big gang, by conquering and absorbing other gangs with Asian members and discarding the non-Asians
Recruits all Asians in Brockton Bay aged 12–60
Had consistently avoided capture until meeting Taylor
Is now in custody awaiting trial
Tattletale includes him as an example of capes fucked up in the head
Reached out to Bakuda when she was at Cornell
Escaped arrest after being blinded by Skitter
Brought into custody

appearance.value: Big, but not so big he would send people running when he walked down the street; a little over six feet
Sprawling tattoos from the neck down depicting Eastern dragons

notes.value: Ornate metal mask
No shirt
The longer he's in a fight, the more potent all his powers get
The longer he's in a fight, the more potent all his powers get
Heals at a superhuman rate
Heals at a superhuman rate
Healing includes shrugging off poisons and drugs
Grows stronger, tougher, and bigger
Grows stronger, tougher, and bigger
Grows armour plating, and blades at fingertips
Grows armour plating, and blades at fingertips
According to rumour, grows wings if he fights long enough
Grows wings if he fights long enough
Starts to return to normal once nobody is left to fight
Gains enhanced hearing
With prolonged fighting grows to fifteen feet
Grows layers of scales that make him look barely human
Shape of his skull becomes catlike, nose and mouth become a single X-shaped opening bristling with pointed teeth sticking in every direction
Can create flame, shape it, and intensify it
Can create flame, shape it, and intensify it
This power also grows stronger as he fights
Includes fireproofing or can create extreme heat around him without burning; also doesn't appear to affect his oxygen supply
Enough to soften metal which he can then push through with his enhanced strength
Can put out Sundancer's sun when sufficiently powered
Has a "do not approach" warning on the Parahumans Online Wiki
Tattletale includes him as an example of capes fucked up in the head

appearance.value: Distinctive

notes.value: Black bodysuit with black bandoleer and belt for knives/guns/grenades
Ornate Japanese-style demon mask, crimson with two green stripes down either side
Except for the mask, gives the impression of a ninja
Mask has leering, fanged, ear-to-ear grin
Can teleport or create doubles of himself (unclear)
Can teleport, after which his original self remains where it is, active for 5–10 seconds before disintegrating into a cloud of carbon ash
Can teleport, after which his original self remains where it is, active for 5–10 seconds before disintegrating into a cloud of carbon ash
Can repeatedly duplicate himself (not limited to one double at a time)
Duplicating himself also duplicates held objects (eg grenades)
Duplicating himself unavoidably also duplicates held or touched objects (eg grenades, bugs)
Previously committed petty crime and worked as an enforcer
Nice adult voice
Has an apartment
Takes school courses online
Was taught a little boxing by his father
Two years of experience prior to the Undersiders
Parents split up when he was 13; he lived with his father
His father was a hard man; no warmth, not the type meant to raise a son alone
Got three months' community service for beating up his mother's boyfriend (when he had his trigger event)
Went into villainy to raise money to fight his mother to gain custody of Aisha

appearance.value: Tall
At least a foot taller than Taylor, dark chocolate skin, shoulder length cornrows, masculine lantern jaw, muscle definition in arms
Good looking
Is able to blend in both as an ordinary Docks resident and as a high-class Boardwalk shopper
Two or three years older than Regent/Taylor
Hair (still in cornrows) forming long, loose ponytail
Described as six foot, though this contradicts Taylor's earlier description
Wide, genial smile; a smile that hid nothing, as honest and unguarded as you'd expect from a ten-year-old finding out he'd just unwrapped the exact gift he wanted for his birthday
Broad shoulders

notes.value: Black motorcycle leathers, motorcycle helmet, full-face visor stylised to look like a skull
Power soaks through the porous leather; visor has vents at the edges to prevent the power from obscuring the face so you can see the skull
Darkness generation
Darkness generation
notes.provenance: Parahumans Online Wiki (entry written by Grue himself)

notes.value: Can generate a shadow of darkness, like a jet-black curtain, feels oily to the touch with inconsistent texture, and when engulfed in it produces total darkness; dissolves into wisps of black smoke when dissipated
Darkness also absorbs noise
Grue is barely affected by his own power
Also cuts off radio signals and dampens radiation
He can use his power to alter the sound of his voice
Can direct darkness eg to fill a specific room
Darkness can form tendrils
Darkness fades after 20 minutes or so
Makes you feel resistance, like you're underwater but not floating
Can make blobs of shadow that look roughly like people, for decoys
Received a text from Aisha saying "Help me"
Went to his mother's house (where his sister was living) as fast as possible
Aisha had been crying, didn't say why; he started to leave with her and found his way barred by his mother's new boyfriend
Immediately knew said boyfriend was the reason Aisha had asked for help, as she shrank back and held him tighter; he went cold
Put Aisha down and beat his mother's boyfriend within an inch of his life, with his mother screaming and wailing
Took Aisha to his dad's, went to police the next day
Realised he'd got powers when he was washing the blood out of his torn knuckles that evening and saw the darkness leaking out alongside the blood
Said he wasn't feeling rage or fear when he had his trigger event, but in fact was feeling nothing
Already has her G.E.D. (cheated using her powers to get it)
A year older than Taylor
Doesn't do the relationship thing, because her power takes the mystery out of things when relationships are founded on self delusion and lies

appearance.value: Long, windblown dark blond hair
Vulpine grin that turns up at the corners
Smattering of freckles over bridge of her nose, bottle-glass green eyes
More pretty than not
Hair down and loose when in costume, ponytail or braided when not

notes.value: Skintight combining black with light blue or purple, simple black domino style mask
Skintight combining black with lavender, simple black domino style mask
Smears eyelids in black facepaint to match the mask
Mask narrow, surrounding eye sockets, covering eyebrows, some of her nose and cheekbones, hiding her freckles and changing the apparent lines of her face
Bodysuit lavender with bands of black across chest and down sides of arm, legs, and body; dark grey on black stylised eye, visible only in the right light, part of the design
Compact utility belt sits diagonally across hips, with a variety of compact pockets and pouches
Carries a small handgun
Has some way of detecting or tracking the heroes
Her abilities are said to be half the reason the Undersiders haven't failed a job yet
Her power tells her things, such as locations of people she's interested in
Heroes suspects she has a power that helps her detect or track heroes, but don't know how
Her abilities are said to be half the reason the Undersiders haven't failed a job yet
Fills in gaps in her knowledge; given some starting info her power will fill in extra details, which can compound and snowball into a steady stream of knowledge
Can figure out passwords
Best at concrete information; can read info out of body language or changes to routine but it's less reliable
Her power can make mistakes or lead her to the wrong educated guesses sometimes
Claims to be psychic to explain powers to her enemies
Extensive of power takes a lot out of her
If she is given incorrect information, her powers give her false info in return
Was able to get Danny's phone number with her power

cape_names.note: Name used by the media to avoid profanity

notes.value: Never had a secret identity
Was homeless for most of her previous career
Manifested powers at 14 before demolishing her foster home, injuring her foster mother and two children
Has a "do not approach" warning on the Parahumans Online Wiki
No family, but too old and unattractive to be adopted, so spent a decade in foster care, fighting with other kids; Grue reckons this messed her up mentally, and getting powers made things worse
Never went to school
Tattletale includes her as an example of capes fucked up in the head
Wanted for serial murder; though Tattletale reckons with a fair trial she'd get manslaughter at worst, or reckless endangerment
When she first got her powers (not knowing what they entailed) the dog she used them on was untrained and killed people
Rescues dogs from dogfighting ring
Didn't tell the Undersiders about the dogfighting ring
Power messed up her ability to understand human body language and tone

appearance.value: Dark-haired, not pretty, squarish blunt-featured face with thick eyebrows
An unkind person might call her butch, guy-like features, nose broken more than once, solidly-built, not fat, shortish auburn hair
Has the kind of smile from someone who'd never seen one before and tried to replicate it from what they'd read in books, with too many teeth showing

notes.value: Not much of a costume — plaid skirt, army boots, torn-up sleeveless t-shirt, hard plastic dollar-store rottweiler mask
Costume varies — sometimes wears jacket with fur ruff collar and hard plastic bulldog mask

Has dogs that are huge and monstrous ("The size of a van, resembling a cross between a lizard and a tiger, with tangles of muscles and bone where it ought to have skin, scales or fur") which she can order around and people can ride on
Dogs are made monstrous by transforming ordinary dogs using her power
Dogs are made monstrous by transforming ordinary dogs using her power
Works on any dog, but she can't control dogs with powers, so well-trained dogs are most useful

When dogs transform, the fur splits at the seams, muscle and bone showing beneath in an atypical anatomical arrangement, slow enough change that you can't see it happen if you look continuously, eyes deeper set, spikes, spurs, and exoskeleton of bone growths cover gaps and at places where bone is close to skin, longer prehensile tails looking like a pair of human spines end-on-end with meat still hanging off
Can exhaust self or dogs if transformation is rushed
Performs transformation quickly when stopping dogfighting ring
Dogs can perform acrobatic leaps onto/off sides of buildings
Seeing the dogs transform is like seeing a sausage split its casing, only the casing is fur and skin
When injured in transformed state, they'll heal when they return to normal
Has extra ability to understand dogs by their body language and tone, at the expense of her ability to understand people by theirs
Dropped out of school

appearance.value: Short black curls, build like a dancer
About Taylor's age, good-looking but not handsome, pretty, triangular face, light blue eyes, full lips in a scowl, French or Italian heritage
Little muscle worth speaking about

notes.value: White mask, similar to but less decorative than those used in Venice carnivals, silver coronet, ruffled white shirt, skintight leggings tucked into knee-high boots; renaissance faire style
Mask interior has foam shaped to his face contours, with mouth left free to talk unmuffled
Loose white shirt covers a mesh vest molded to the shape of his body
Loose dark gray shirt covers a mesh vest molded to the shape of his body
Carries scepter with a taser built into the crowned orb at the top
Costume deliberately misleading to give the impression of vulnerability
Can fire off impulses in other people's nervous systems that set off reflexes or make body parts jerk, eg to make someone fall over, drop something, lose balance, or pull a trigger
Enough range to effectively delay opposition at the front doors from the vault door of the bank
If he uses it too much, it backfires and causes his arm to cramp up
If he continues to use his power after a backfire, goes unconscious, and becomes sore and powerless for a while
Has his own action figures
Lost command of his team for two days and was interrogated due to Lung being near-fatally dosed with venom

appearance.value: Beard trimmed to trace the edges of his jaw
Late twenties or early thirties
Nice smile

notes.value: Body armour dark blue with silver highlights, sharply angled v-shaped visor covering eyes and nose, chest emblem of visor silhouetted in blue against silver background
Armored gauntlets
Probably has tinker powers
notes.provenance: Taylor suspects from the fact that he carries tinker gear

notes.value: Has built trademark weapon: six-foot long halberd souped up with sci-fi gadgets such as a grappling hook
Other Halberd powers include ability to cut through steel like butter, plasma injectors, directed EMP
Other Halberd powers include ability to cut through steel like butter, plasma injectors
Halberd can also shoot directed EMP blasts
Has souped up his motorcycle
Appears to have built a lie detector
Has a lie detector
notes.provenance: Direct witness, confirmed by his own statement

notes.value: Specialises in condensing and integrating technology
Halberd modified to sense vibrations in the air, translating them into images, to combat Grue's power
Halberd modified to pass electrical charge in the brass between floor tiles to zap bugs
Halberd can reconfigure its physical shape
Can analyse enemies and predict their movements ahead of time on a heads up display in his suit
Can teleport his Halberd back into his hand if he drops it
First appearance by way of a drawn-out terrorism campaign against Cornell University
Voice is altered by mask to be a mechanical, robotic, monotone hiss
Voice sounds like Robbie the Robot with a sore throat
Claims to be a genius
Plans that if she dies, every bomb she's planted will go off
Narcissistic with megalomania; always receives praise and rarely criticism
Starts a terrorist bombing campaign against Brockton Bay
Lung reached out to her when she was at Cornell
Now has three hundred soldiers with implanted bombs
Brought into custody

appearance.value: Straight black hair
Age and ethnicity hard to pinpoint from available photo

notes.value: Large opaque goggles, metal mask with gas mask style filter covering lower half of face
Braided cord of black, yellow, and green wires looped around one shoulder
Worn as part of a deal to hire Über and Lee
Blue leotard with broad belt cinched around waist, skintight white sleeve and leggings
Elastic hood, clinging to head so it only leaves a window for the face, single white antenna
Gloves, boots, ball at top of antenna bubblegum pink
Face obscured by oversize goggles with red lenses
Gas mask-style fixture over lower face
Tinker with specialty in designing and building high tech bombs
Tinker with specialty in designing and building high tech bombs
Made a bomb that disguises itself as a person
Made a miniature black hole
Made a bomb that slows down/stops time, effect greater closer to the centre of the explosion
Has modified jeep-mounted mortar launcher and grenade launcher
Made "the six-eighteen" which liquefies people into a goopy mess, modelled off Tesla's work on vibrations
Can detonate her bombs using thought
Made a bomb which explodes with ice
Can detonate her bombs using toe rings, but pretends this is through thought
Can detonate her bombs using toe rings, but pretends this is through thought
Goggles can see heat signatures
Guns keyed to her fingerprints
While trying to make a space distortion grenade by studying Vista's power, instead made two-seventy-seven, a space distortion grenade that only works on living material, and doesn't kill you
Produced a grenade that can affect the nervous system to cause pain
Produced gluey string grenades
Undersiders speculate that her trigger event was likely relating to her rarely receiving criticism and often receiving praise
Tattletale suspects she was passed over for a job or someone bitched her out
Taylor points out she held a university hostage, so suspects she got bad marks, failed a class, or was passed over for a teaching assistant position

cape_names.note: Responded with this when asked "Kto vy?" ("What are you?")

notes.value: First appeared naked 20th May 1982, spotted from an ocean liner, looking deeply sad
Has only been known to speak once, when asked "Kto vy?" ("What are you?")
First parahuman to appear on Earth

appearance.value: Long hair, burnished gold skin and hair, no body hair, seems almost artificial

notes.value: Naked
Sheet worn over one shoulder and pinned at either side of the waist
More conventional clothes
White bodysuit (worn since 1999) of unknown provenance
When people touched him, they burst into tears or felt awed, or lost suicidal tendencies
Healed a person's cancer on touch
Can freeze water with a flash of light
Can extinguish widespread fire
Has quelled a volcano
Can fly faster than the speed of sound
Had cancer cured by Scion
Last passenger on the initial cruise to touch Scion
First publicly-reported instance of a cape dying

cause_of_death.value: Brain embolism after being clubbed over the head attempting to quell a riot over a basketball game in Michigan in 1989

occupations.value: Union spokesperson and head of hiring

based_in.value: A house on the outskirts of the Docks with Taylor

notes.value: Has PoV Interlude
Works an unreliable schedule
Pet project is trying to get the ferry back up and running

appearance.value: Large eyes
Hair thinned enough at the top to be closer to baldness than not, stick thin, glasses, bad fashion sense
Weak chin, dark hair

notes.value: Has not slept in Danny's house for some time and wouldn't pick up her phone if he called

appearance.value: Thin-lipped, wide, expressive mouth
B-cup (post pregnancy)
Big guy, burly, Black Irish

notes.value: Video game theme
About as incompetent as villains can be while staying out of jail
Streams all cape activity online using a camera mounted in a sphere the size of a tennis ball, moving like a hummingbird, on a ½-1 hour delay
Theme themselves after a different videogame for each escapade
Fails more often than succeeds, makes more money from streaming than from crime proceeds, been arrested no less than three times, will likely be sent to the Birdcage next time

appearance.value: Sculpted physique, broad-shouldered and tall, lines of muscles visible through costume

notes.value: Blue man-leotard with broad belt cinched around waist, skintight white sleeve and leggings
Elastic hood, clinging to head so it only leaves a window for the face, single white antenna
Gloves, boots, ball at top of antenna bubblegum pink
Face obscured by oversize goggles with dark lenses
Dressed as Bowser in Mario-themed escapade
Can figure out how to do anything like he's an expert at it, likely extending to escapology

Makes him sound like the guy who narrated trailers for action movies or late night commercials; overdramatic and intense about everything no matter how mundane, like an overacted gallant knight in a kid's movie
Makes him talented; for instance playing harmonica, parkour stunts, Muay Thai; can pull them off as if he'd been working on them for a few hours a day most of his life
If he really focuses, can be top notch
Video game theme
About as incompetent as villains can be while staying out of jail
Streams all cape activity online using a camera mounted in a sphere the size of a tennis ball, moving like a hummingbird, on a ½-1 hour delay
Theme themselves after a different videogame for each escapade
Fails more often than succeeds, makes more money from streaming than from crime proceeds, been arrested no less than three times, will likely be sent to the Birdcage next time

appearance.value: Scrawny, weak chin, bad slouch

Can make anything once,
The closer a newly-made thing is to a thing he's made before, the more likely it is to blow up in his face, misfire, or otherwise break comically
Invents solid hologram fake bombs
Alright teacher, but not the most hands on
Can supposedly use magic
Drummer
Is out of touch with reality

appearance.value: Long-haired

notes.value: Smarter than average, but no filter
Was Taylor's favourite protectorate member when she was a kid
Flight
Super strength
Invincibility

cape_names.notes: What they're referred to as to Taylor

notes.value: A large part of the reason the Undersiders haven't failed a job yet
Is anonymous to the Undersiders (except possibly Tattletale, with whom he's made a deal)

appearance.value: Dense covering of freckles on face and hands, curly brown hair

notes.value: Red and black costume with a gasmask
Spews a geyser of fluid out the nozzle at the base of her mask, which ignites on contact
Twenty-something
Tattletale claims her personality and powers suck
Very good at finding hidden strengths in those who work for her
Owns Palanquin and other cover businesses across Brockton Bay

appearance.value: Straight black hair in a long bristling ponytail
Wavy black hair tied back in a ponytail
Features too sharp to be called conventionally attractive, but still more sharp than Newter or Gregor the Snail

notes.value: Blend of riot gear, martial arts uniform, and a dress
Can slice arbitrary things, from thin coin-shaped slices of wood to entire buildings
Does not work on living things (Manton effect)
Power activated with a swipe gesture, and crackles with red and blue energy
Clown makeup, jester's cap, teal and orange skintight costume, coattails
Bells jangling from tips of cap, coattails, gloves, and boots
Details different every time she goes out, but theme is the same
Minor pyrokinesis
Ability to deposit items into thin air
Ability to retrieve those items just as easily
Greatly enhanced coordination and balance
Has PoV Interlude
Struggles to hold back and thus has nearly killed six people
Among the most famous of Brockton Bay heroes
Taking Parahumans 101 at the university even though she's still in high school

appearance.value: Beautiful, tall, gorgeous, blonde

notes.value: White one-piece dress that comes up to mid-thigh (with shorts underneath), over-the-shoulder cape, high boots, golden tiara with radiating spikes
Shows off her figure
Can fly freely
Can push 80mph
Can carry another person when flying
Has an invisible forcefield which extends a few millimetres over skin and clothes
Keeps chill off but still allows her to feel wind, avoids bugs splatting when flying fast
Strong enough to crack asphalt
Strong enough to lift an SUV over her head
Forcefield shorts out for a few seconds when hit hard eg with gunshot
Produces waves of energy that those in her presence experience as awe and admiration; those who have reason to fear here instead experience it as intimidation
Can be switched on/off and varied in intensity
Getting fouled while playing basketball in gym class, according to her account in interviews

appearance.value: Tan skinned
Puerto Rican, long hair

notes.value: Rust red costume with matching helmet, both with silver-white trim and a shield emblem
Flight
Flight
His entire biology is filled with so many redundancies and reinforcements you can't put him down
His entire biology is filled with so many redundancies and reinforcements you can't put him down
Throw sand in his eyes and he can sense light on his skin; cut his throat and it bleeds no more than a hand; other organs can take over if you stab his heart; can reattach arms if they're cut off
Can abuse his body to make it seem like he's super strong, eg throw punches hard enough to break hands/mangle joints/tear muscles
Can abuse his body to make it seem like he's super strong, eg throw punches hard enough to break hands/mangle joints/tear muscles
Can draw on adrenaline to avoid fatigue
Went too far and nearly killed someone, which led to her arrest where a deal was struck

Stationed to protect the mall when Taylor visited with her dad

appearance.value: About as tall as Taylor

notes.value: Dark gray urban-camouflage hood and cape

Power interacts strangely with Grue's Darkness generation; reduces her speed, agility, and invisibility

appearance.value: Mousy
Brown frizzy hair, freckles spaced evenly across face

notes.value: Robe (alabaster white with medical red cross on chest and back) with large hood and scarf that covers the lower half of her face
Only a shade away from being a Burka, reckons Glory Girl
Can heal people's injuries when touching their skin
Takes some time to perform
Includes giving people a "tune-up", making them feel on top of the world physically, as if they'd been to a spa and had the best nutritionist, fitness expert and doctor looking after them for a month

Brilliantly blue eyes

Includes gauntlets

Can create metal from thin air

cape_names.notes: What they were referred to as when anonymous to Taylor

occupations.value: Villain in control of a private army

One of the most powerful players in town, considers himself a chessmaster, according to Tattletale

A large part of the reason the Undersiders haven't failed a job yet

appearance.value: Taller than Grue, but thin to the point of being skeletal

Black with white snake, head starting at Coil's forehead, tail extending down the back of his head, looping and winding over his entire body before ending at one of his ankles

appearance.value: Heavy cheeked caucasian with acne-scarred cheeks and long hair pulled back into a greasy ponytail

notes.value: Upper half of face covered with metal mask and goggles

Modified military uniform, tight enough to accentuate her curves, scarf around lower face with embroidered American flag, similar sash around waist

Recently (at start of story) turned 18

appearance.value: Big, muscular and tough

notes.value: Gold lion helm, shoulderpads and belt, and skintight suit
Sonic shout allows him to punch holes through concrete
Shockwaves can disorient and make you see double
White skintight costume with interlocking panels of glossy white body armour, placed wherever they could give him protection without inhibiting movement
Armour has dark grey images of clocks on it, some animated so they drift across the surface, others fixed in place with hands ticking
Smooth expanse of white for a helmet, faceless
He can stop time for whatever he touches; the person or object affected is put on 'pause'
He can stop time for whatever he touches; the person or object affected is put on 'pause'
Works for thirty seconds to ten minutes, but he can't control the duration
The stopped person or thing can't be hurt or moved; he uses this defensively to make unbreakable shields
The stopped person or thing can't be hurt or moved; he uses this defensively to make unbreakable shields
Can't disable the effects (ie un-stop an object)
12 years old (at start of story)
Costume with skirt, all covered in wavy, swooping lines alternating between white and forest green
Body armour included in costume design; breastplate moulded to give the illusion of a chest
Can stretch a building like taffy, so it's twice as tall, or squeeze two sidewalks together so she can cross the street in one step
Can stretch a building like taffy, so it's twice as tall, or squeeze two sidewalks together so she can cross the street in one step
Distortions can resemble a funhouse mirror
Manton effect; can't stretch or compress people, and makes altering an area harder the more people are in it

Can create forcefields

No cup

Expected that he would eventually surpass the Triumvirate
